Module andrei.pt_30424_pelle_andrei_assignment_3
Package andrei.data

Class DataAccessClass<T>

java.lang.Object
andrei.data.DataAccessClass<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type parameter for the class: Order, Product or Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientDAO, OrdersDAO, ProductDAO
public class DataAccessClass<T> extends Object
This class defines methods that do the CRUD operations in the database. The object properties are created and read through reflection. A type T is given as a parameter. At the base level, the functions create word by word an SQL script that will provide the required operation in the database.

    • DataAccessClass

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      public List<T> findAll()
      The query to select is very simple because the table name is the same as the class name, so it is just one line. In the generated result set, we iterate entry by entry. For each field that is in class we get the corresponding method for writing and execute it using the value returned from the result set. The object is then added to the list of objects. At the end of the function, the list is returned.
      Returns:
      a list of the objects extracted from the database.

    • insert

      public void insert(T obj)
      The insert method will insert an object of generic type into the database. First we iterate through field names and append them in the first parentheses, then we invoke the read method for the object for each field. '' quotes are used to keep postgres happy. Integer types are also quoted, but it does not affect the statement. No return.
      Parameters:
      obj - -> object to be inserted into the database. Does not have an id, will be dynamically generated by the database. If the sequence in the database is corrupted, an exception will be thrown because of bad id generation.

    • update

      public void update(T obj)
      The update method will edit an object already present in the database. The fields are already updated by the controller layer, so we don't care about any of that. We will set all the fields as given. Thus, we call the field read method, read the properties, append them and then call the statement. Big difference is that this time we have an id which shall be used in the WHERE clause to identify the object in the database.
      Parameters:
      obj - -> object to be updated in the database. Does have an id, it shall be used to uniquely identify the object.

    • delete

      public void delete(T obj)

      private List<T> createObjects(ResultSet resultSet)

    • createSelectQuery

      private String createSelectQuery(String field)

    • findById

      public T findById(int id)
      The function given by the template. Modified to catch exception of invalid id instead of termination.
      Parameters:
      id - -> id of object to be inserted
      Returns:
      -> found object or NULL in the case of failure

    • findMaxId

      public T findMaxId() throws IntrospectionException, InvocationTargetException, IllegalAccessException
      This function returns the object with max id. Used by the bill generator to create the name since I have no idea what id will be generated by the database, but I can be pretty certain it will be the biggest one.
      Returns:
      -> object with the maximum id from column
      Throws:
      IntrospectionException
      InvocationTargetException
      IllegalAccessException
